name: ShipExternalOrder
description: Ships an order that has been exported to an external system by another proces
auth_description: Requires a user of type `Employee` or `Api` with functionality `CreateExternalShipment:None`

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

request_samples.name: CURL

E.name: DateTimeValue
E.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

E.name: NumberValue
E.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

E.name: StringValue
E.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

D.name: CustomFieldID
D.description:
Identifier for the custom field

This is the ID of a `CustomField`

D.name: DateTimeValue
D.description: Used for datatype DateTime and Date

D.name: NumberValue
D.description: Used for datatype Integer and Decimal

D.name: StringValue
D.description: Used for datatype String, Text and Enum

F.name: BackendID
F.description: Used to identify the order line - required if ID and Barcode are omitted

F.name: Barcode
F.description: Used to identify the order line - required if ID and BackendID are omitted

F.name: ID
F.description:
Used to identify the order line - required if BackendID and Barcode are omitted

This is the ID of a `OrderLine`

F.name: Quantity
F.description: Number of products that have been shipped

F.name: SerialNumber
F.description: In case of serial number products (like gift cards), this field is required and indicates the shipped serial number

G.name: PackageID
G.description: This is the ID of a `Package`

C.name: BackendSystemID
C.description: Identifier of the system that created the shipment

C.name: PackageID
C.description: This is the ID of a `Package`

C.name: ShipFromOrganizationUnitID
C.description:
Create shipment as being shipped from this OU, which affects which stock is mutated and the financial consequences of that

This is the ID of a `OrganizationUnit`

C.name: TrackingCode
C.description: Optional tracking code that is stored on the shipment.

C.name: TrackingLink
C.description: Optional tracking link that is stored on the shipment

B.name: BackendID
B.description: Reference to the order that is being shipped - required when `ID` is omitted

B.name: BackendSystemID
B.description: Reference to the system from which the order originated - required when `ID` is omitted

B.name: FinalShipment
B.description: Indicates if this is the last shipment - when set to true will cancel any remaining lines that are not shipped

B.name: ID
B.description:
ID of the order that is being shipped - required when `BackendID` and `BackendSystemID` are omitted

This is the ID of a `Order`

I.name: Code
I.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

I.name: Message
I.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

I.name: RequestID
I.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

I.name: Type
I.description: A short description of the error type.

J.name: ExternalIDs
J.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

J.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
J.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

J.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
J.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.

H.name: ShipmentIDs
H.description: This is the ID of a `Shipment`
